head.supplied: ¶ Lonah. Ulverstone ¶ Tasmania ¶ Dec 23/89. ¶ To Baron von Mueller ¶ ¶ &c &c....

div.p: RB MSS M108a, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; text-align: end;

div.p:
Text proofed but not plant names
Lonah. Ulverstone

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; text-align: end;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; text-align: end;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: At last I have been able to prepare a set of duplicate Algae for you, which go by this same post. The list will shew you that they are not quite complete but as nearly so as I can at present make them — & I hope they are correctly identified — but I am unfortunately very ignorant on the subject of Algae.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: If you would be kind enough to give me an introduction to Professor Agardh, with his postal address, I could send him specimens direct, & would let you have any duplicates of fresh species. Would that suit your purpose & perhaps save you trouble? Of the desired Echlonie I have not yet come across any more specimens. There were a great many specimens in my original parcel of which I had not duplicates, & should have liked to have them returned with their names. But if they are of use to the Professor it is better he should have the benefit of them of course.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: I am enclosing a specimen of a shrub foung by Dr. Smyth of Latrobe, at Green's Creek a few miles inland from Port Sorell. It was sent to me during the winter & is very brittle. When fresh is must be a pretty thing, & the Doctor thinks it rare if not new. I have not been able to identify it at all, but it may be well known, for all that — & your verdict will be gratefully received.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: With kind regards & all best wishes, I remain

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Mary Lodder.
MS annotation by M: 'Answ 1/2/90 FvM'.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p:
Tasmanian Algae, as named from Prof. Agardh's list.
See also the undated list of J. Agardh's identifications of M. Lodder's algae, sent to M with his letter of 29 September 1889, collected at the mouth of the Leven River, N. Tasmania, at M's request. See M to J. Agardh, 30 June 1889, announcing the dispatch of 2 packets of algae from Miss Lodder. — M sent copies of the lists of identifications to the collectors where requested. The misreadings of names (below) could have occurred in Melbourne, when M's assistants copied the lists. For Baron von Mueller.

p.style: margin-top: 0in; margin-bottom: 0in; text-align: start; hyphenation-ladder-count: no-limit; font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; hyphenate: false; hyphenation-remain-char-count: 2; hyphenation-push-char-count: 2;

div.p: From M. Lodder, Ulverstone, N. Tas. Dec. 1889.

cell.p: x I have no duplicate of no 1. which is Sporochnus pedunculatus .

cell.p:
43. Plocamium angustatum
A misreading of J. Agardh's Plocamium angustum.
